Types

Normal = object
  x*, y*, z*: float
Normal object: (x, y, z) floats Represents a Normal in the 3D space 
ONB = object
  e1*, e2*, e3*: Vec
Ortho Normal Basis: (x, y, z) floats Represents an Orto Normal Basis in the 3D space 
Point = object
  x*, y*, z*: float
Point object: (x, y, z) floats Represents a Point in the 3D space 
Vec = object
  x*, y*, z*: float
Vec object: (x, y, z) floats Represents a Vec in the 3D space 
Vec2d = object
  u*, v*: float
Vec2d object: (u,v) floats ## Represents a Vec in the 2D space

Consts

VEC_X: Vec = (x: 1.0, y: 0.0, z: 0.0)
VEC_Y: Vec = (x: 0.0, y: 1.0, z: 0.0)
VEC_Z: Vec = (x: 0.0, y: 0.0, z: 1.0)

Norm of a Vector or a Normal 
template define_normalization(t: typedesc)
Modify the vector's norm so that it becomes equal to 1 
template define_normalized_dot(t1, t2: typedesc)
Apply a dot product to the two arguments after having normalized them. The result is the cosine of the angle between the two vectors/normals. 
template define_product(t: typedesc)
Product between a scalar and an object (Vec, Point, Normal)
